title: Domino's Pizza customer shocked after Friday night takeaway comes with an extra illegal offer on the side
text:
Domino's Pizza customer shocked after Friday night takeaway comes with an extra illegal offer on the side A drug dealer's makeshift business card - signed 'Smokey' - was attached to the box Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Investigation after Domino's pizza came with illegal offer Share this video Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
A Domino’s Pizza customer was left shocked when their takeaway came with the offer of an added side of MDMA, ketamine and "much more." 
A calling card for a local drug dealer was attached to a Friday night order from a branch in Liverpool. 
The pizza , which was delivered at around 9pm on February 10, had a small blue card attached to the box which read: WEED, MDMA, PILLS, KET, RAW COKE & MUCH MORE. GET ON ME, DROP OFFS ALL NIGHT. SMOKEY." 
It gave customers the option of calling two numbers to obtain various illegal substances, the Liverpool Echo reports. 
The incident was reported to Merseyside Police and is currently being investigated along with a number of similar reports. Read More The incident is being investigated by Merseyside Police alongside similar reports (Photo: Liverpool Echo) The little blue card had two mobile numbers on it (Photo: Liverpool Echo) 
The Liverpool Echo said it understands that the advertising approach has been used on various occasions across the city since November 2016. 
Local Domino’s stores are franchised out to separate owners and drivers are employed by the store, not the Domino’s parent company. 
Friday’s delivery came from the London Road store in Liverpool city centre but it is not known whether the owner of the franchise had any knowledge of it. No-one from the store has been willing to comment. 
But Nina Arnott, spokesperson for Domino’s said: “We have suspended the individual in question whilst we investigate this issue in conjunction with Merseyside Police. 
“Police enquiries into the incident and any others that may be linked are currently ongoing.” 
A spokesman for the police said: “Merseyside Police is investigating an incident of suspicious circumstances at an address in Liverpool City Centre on Friday, 10 February. 
“At around 9.40pm, a report was received of a pizza delivery driver attending at a premises in Seymour Street. Food was delivered and a note was allegedly left offering drugs for sale, including phone numbers.” 
If you or anyone you know have received similar cards please get in contact with Merseyside Police on 101. Like us on Facebook
